node.title: VoiceFlow Project Plan
node.comment: This master plan outlines the comprehensive strategy for developing, launching, and scaling the VoiceFlow Project. This third revision adds further granularity, highlights dependencies, and integrates actionable metrics for a more robust and executable plan.

node.title: Phase 1: Technical Development
node.comment: This phase focuses on building out the core application features, ensuring a robust and scalable technical foundation. The core transcription engine is complete, so the focus now shifts to user-facing features and infrastructure.

node.title: Core Transcription Engine
node.comment: The initial MVP for browser-side transcription is complete and validated, using @xenova/transformers.js. This is a major milestone. The development server is running and the whisper-demo page is functional.

node.title: Feature Parity with Competitors
node.comment: To be competitive, we need to implement features offered by MacWhisper and Audio Note. This is critical for market acceptance and moving beyond the MVP. This work can be parallelized with Phase 2 activities.

node.title: Advanced Export Functionality
node.comment: Allow users to export transcripts in various formats. This is a key feature for professional users. A reusable export module should be created to easily add new formats in the future.

node.title: Implement Subtitle Export
node.comment: Support for .srt and .vtt formats is standard and required by content creators (podcasters, video editors).

node.title: Implement Document Export
node.comment: Support for .txt, .pdf, and .docx formats for wider usability in business and academic contexts.

node.title: Transcript Interaction
node.comment: Enhance the user's ability to work with the generated transcript, turning it from static text into a dynamic document. Performance with large transcripts (1+ hour) must be a consideration.

node.title: Implement Transcript Search
node.comment: Allow users to search for specific words within the transcript, a fundamental feature for long audio files.

node.title: Implement In-Place Editing
node.comment: Allow users to correct transcription errors directly in the UI. This builds user trust and improves output quality.

node.title: Link Audio Playback to Transcript
node.comment: Clicking on a word in the transcript should jump to that point in the audio playback. This is a huge time-saver for verification.

node.title: Advanced Features & Differentiators
node.comment: Features that will set VoiceFlow Pro apart from the competition and create a strong value proposition. These should be prioritized based on feedback from user interviews.

node.title: Real-time Transcription
node.comment: Transcribe audio from the microphone in real-time, providing instant feedback and notes.

node.title: System Audio Transcription
node.comment: RISK: This is technically complex and may require a separate desktop application. De-prioritized for initial launch but a key feature for a 'Pro' offering.

node.title: Speaker Diarization
node.comment: Identify and label different speakers in the transcript. This is a high-value feature for interviews, meetings, and podcasts.

node.title: Infrastructure & Backend
node.comment: Ensure the backend services are ready for production, focusing on security, scalability, and user management. DEPENDENCY: This must be in place before paid launch.

node.title: Setup User Authentication
node.comment: Integrate Supabase for user login, registration, and management. This is a foundational step for a SaaS product.

node.title: Develop File Storage Solution
node.comment: Implement secure, scalable storage for user audio files and transcripts, likely using Supabase Storage or a similar service.

node.title: Setup CI/CD Pipeline
node.comment: Set up a continuous integration and deployment pipeline (e.g., using GitHub Actions) to automate testing and deployment to Vercel/AWS.

node.title: User Onboarding & Experience
node.comment: Create a seamless and welcoming experience for new users to drive activation and retention. A good onboarding flow is a feature in itself.

node.title: Design Welcome Tour
node.comment: Create a short, interactive tour that highlights key features and helps users get their first transcription done quickly (the 'Aha!' moment).

node.title: Implement Onboarding Checklist
node.comment: A simple checklist to guide new users through essential setup steps (e.g., upload first file, try an export, invite a team member).

node.title: Create Email Onboarding Sequence
node.comment: Write a 5-7 email sequence to educate new users on features, provide tips, and keep them engaged during their first week.

node.title: Phase 2: Business Foundation
node.comment: Establish the legal and financial structure of the business. This is a critical path to launch and can be done in parallel with technical development.

node.title: Legal Foundation
node.comment: Draft and finalize all necessary legal documents to protect the business and its users. These must be easily accessible from the application footer.

node.title: Draft Terms of Service & Privacy Policy
node.comment: Create comprehensive ToS and Privacy Policy documents, including GDPR/CCPA compliance clauses. Use templates and consult with a lawyer.

node.title: Draft License Agreement
node.comment: Define licensing tiers (e.g., Individual, Team, Lifetime) and their terms of use.

node.title: Attorney Review
node.comment: Have all legal documents reviewed by a qualified attorney specializing in software and SaaS. Do not skip this step.

node.title: Business Registration
node.comment: Officially register the business entity to operate legally.

node.title: Form LLC
node.comment: Register 'VoiceFlow Pro LLC' in the chosen jurisdiction and obtain an EIN from the IRS for tax purposes.

node.title: File for Trademark
node.comment: Perform a trademark search and file an application for the 'VoiceFlow Pro' name and logo to protect the brand.

node.title: Payment & Pricing
node.comment: Set up the system to process payments and define the pricing strategy. DEPENDENCY: User interviews should inform value-based pricing.

node.title: Define Pricing Tiers
node.comment: Finalize pricing for different tiers (e.g., Free, Pro, Teams) based on features, usage limits (e.g., transcription hours/month), and competitor analysis.

node.title: Configure Stripe Account
node.comment: Set up Stripe, configure products/plans matching the pricing tiers, and integrate webhooks for subscription management.

node.title: Build Pricing & Checkout UI
node.comment: Develop the public pricing page and integrate the Stripe checkout flow into the application's subscription management area.

node.title: Implement Subscription Management UI
node.comment: Create the in-app UI for users to view their current plan, upgrade, downgrade, cancel their subscription, and view invoice history.

node.title: Test Payment Flow End-to-End
node.comment: Conduct thorough testing of the entire payment and subscription lifecycle (signup, upgrade, downgrade, cancellation, failed payments) using Stripe's test environment.

node.title: Phase 3: Marketing & Go-to-Market
node.comment: Prepare for launch and build a pipeline of potential customers. Marketing should start long before launch day.

node.title: Branding & Assets
node.comment: Develop a strong, professional brand identity that resonates with the target audience. DEPENDENCY: This should be done before the landing page is built.

node.title: Design Logo and Visual Identity
node.comment: Create the logo, define the color palette, and choose typography. This will inform all public-facing materials.

node.title: Pre-Launch Marketing
node.comment: Generate interest and leads before the product is live to ensure a successful launch.

node.title: Develop Landing Page
node.comment: Create a compelling landing page that clearly explains the value proposition and has a prominent call-to-action to join a waitlist.

node.title: Content Marketing
node.comment: Write blog posts and social media content about transcription, productivity, and use cases to attract the target audience and build SEO authority.

node.title: Build Waitlist
node.comment: Actively promote the landing page to build an email list of potential first users. GOAL: Aim for at least 500 sign-ups before launch day.

node.title: Phase 4: User Feedback & Validation
node.comment: Validate the product with real users to ensure it solves their problems effectively. This phase runs in parallel with development and is the most critical for de-risking the project.

node.title: Customer Discovery
node.comment: Based on the 'Entrepreneurial Journey' coaching, this is a top priority. Get out of the building and talk to users to validate every assumption.

node.title: Identify Target User Profiles
node.comment: Define and document ideal customer profiles (e.g., podcasters, journalists, students, researchers) to focus interview and marketing efforts.

node.title: Conduct User Interviews
node.comment: Schedule and conduct at least 20-30 interviews to deeply understand user pain points, existing workflows, and willingness to pay. Create an interview script to ensure consistent data collection.

node.title: Alpha & Beta Testing
node.comment: Roll out the product to a limited audience to gather feedback, find bugs, and refine the user experience before public launch.

node.title: Private Alpha Test
node.comment: Invite a small group of 5-10 trusted users (identified during interviews) to test the initial product and provide detailed feedback. Offer them a lifetime deal for their contribution.

node.title: Public Beta Program
node.comment: Open the beta to the pre-launch waitlist to test scalability, gather broader feedback, and generate early buzz. Define clear success metrics (e.g., 50% of beta users transcribe >3 files).

node.title: Implement Feedback Loop
node.comment: Set up a system (e.g., Discord, Canny.io) to collect, categorize, and prioritize user feedback systematically. Crucially, 'close the loop' by notifying users when their feedback is implemented.

node.title: Phase 5: Official Launch & Rollout
node.comment: The official public launch of VoiceFlow Pro. This is the culmination of all previous phases.

node.title: Launch Preparation
node.comment: Final checks and preparations in the week leading up to the launch.

node.title: Finalize Production Build
node.comment: Incorporate critical feedback from beta testing, perform final QA, and freeze the code for the launch version.

node.title: Prepare Launch Marketing Campaign
node.comment: Prepare emails for the waitlist (with a special launch day offer), social media announcements, and create a launch kit for Product Hunt or other platforms.

node.title: Launch Day
node.comment: Execute the launch plan with precision.

node.title: Go Live
node.comment: Deploy the application, enable public sign-ups, and switch payment processing to live mode.

node.title: Announce Launch on Key Channels
node.comment: Send out all launch communications across all planned channels (Email, Twitter, LinkedIn, Product Hunt).

node.title: Post-Launch
node.comment: The work doesn't stop at launch. Monitor, support, and iterate.

node.title: Monitor System Performance & Analytics
node.comment: Closely watch server load, error rates (with Sentry), user sign-up funnels, and conversion rates (with Vercel Analytics/Plausible).

node.title: Proactive Customer Support
node.comment: Be ready to respond to user questions and issues promptly across all channels to build a reputation for excellent support. Create canned responses for common questions.

node.title: Plan V1.1 Roadmap
node.comment: Begin planning the next iteration of features based on post-launch feedback and initial usage data, focusing on quick wins and high-impact improvements.
